CHANEL | 2,535,822 followers on LinkedIn. Chanel is a private company and world leader in creating, manufacturing and distributing luxury products, including Ready-to-Wear, Accessories, Fragrances, Makeup, Skincare, Jewellery and Watches. Founded by Gabrielle Chanel in 1910, the House remains dedicated to exceptional craftsmanship and offering high-end creations. Chanel employs more than 32,000 people worldwide.​

Having premiered in Paris in 2020 and travelled to Melbourne, Tokyo and London, the exhibition "Gabrielle Chanel. Fashion Manifesto” is now open in Shanghai. Based on the exhibition created by the Palais Galliera, Fashion Museum of Paris, Paris Musées, it shines a light on the creations of Gabrielle Chanel, drawing the portrait of an avant-garde couturière who changed fashion forever. On the occasion of the opening, Bruno Pavlovsky, President of CHANEL's Fashion, was joined by Miren Arzalluz, Director of the Palais Galliera and curator of the exhibition, Gong Yan, Director of the Power Station of Art in Shanghai, Renaud Bailly, President of North Asia Region at CHANEL, Dr. Jumping He, art director of hesign and graphic designer of the exhibition, and Liz Diller, founding partner of Diller Scofidio + Renfro and designer of the exhibition. The exhibition, which will run from July 12th to November 24th 2024, is presented by the Power Station of Art and co-organized with the Palais Galliera, Fashion Museum of Paris, Paris Musées, and with the exclusive support of CHANEL. #CHANELExhibitions

BEIGE GOLD. THE SIGNATURE GOLD COLOR OF CHANEL. In 2015, gold and beige were merged together to transform into a new material: 18-karat BEIGE GOLD. The metal is used in both watches and fine jewelry, bringing a unique luster to each piece. BEIGE GOLD is the expression of a creative gesture, distinguished by the subtle balance of its nuances. Hundreds of samples were developed to perfect its radiance. Composed of 750 thousandths of fine gold, this exclusive alloy stands apart for its sophistication and uncompromising quality. Choosing BEIGE GOLD means wearing more than just a precious metal. It means donning the color of a truly CHANEL creation. Discover on https://lnkd.in/efsZ3nYZ #CHANELFineJewelry #CHANELWatches

The Haute Joaillerie Sport Collection. The Haute Joaillerie Sport collection celebrates the sports style of CHANEL, anchored in the House’s history since the 1920s. An unprecedented encounter between two worlds where elegance and excellence prevail. From sketches to fabrication, the Creation Studio and the High Jewelry artisans at the workshops on the Place Vendôme in Paris bring to life the most precious, meticulously sourced materials to meet the highest aesthetic and quality standards. Discover the Graphic Line necklace embellished by a 10.15-carat sapphire from Kashmir, a gradation of baguette-cut rubies of 24.35 carats and onyx elements for graphic, simple lines. An exceptional piece, requiring 1 700 hours of work. Discover on https://lnkd.in/e4gaa_8w #CHANELHighJewelry #CHANELHauteJoaillerieSport

Season 4 of CHANEL Connects takes you to the 60th Venice Biennale to meet the artists, curators and thinkers defining creativity today. The flagship arts and culture podcast of the House celebrates innovation across disciplines, through intimate conversations with leading figures convening for this prestigious summit - referred to as the "Art World Olympics" since its 1895 founding. Across historic Venetian sites, CHANEL Connects guests include painter and filmmaker William Kentridge, contemporary artist Julien Creuzet, gallerist Sadie Coles, actress Vicky Krieps, designer Michael Rock and editor Andrew Durbin. Themes range from the power of sound to the technologies of bookmaking, with celebrated speakers generously offering their insights in the most creative dialogues and constructive debates. Released weekly from July 3, experience the cultural event of the year with CHANEL. Available now on all streaming platforms: https://lnkd.in/enHxGNqf #CHANELConnects #CHANEL

International Festival of Interior Design, the “Design Parade Toulon”, with the support of CHANEL and le19M CHANEL and le19M are renewing their support to the International Festival of Interior Design, the “Design Parade Toulon”, of which they are Main Partners. On the occasion of this eighth edition, the House awarded the Visual Merchandising Prize to Romain Joly and Lisa Bravi. The winners will have opportunity to complete a creative project up to 20,000 euros, in collaboration with one or several Maisons d’art resident at le19M, to be exhibited at next year’s festival. In the Old Bishop's House in Toulon, Arthur Ristor and Anaïs Hervé winners of the Visual Merchandising Prize awarded by CHANEL in 2023, presented the window entitled “Les Gardiens”. The creations of the 2023 finalists of the festival will be on show until November 3rd. Meanwhile, the exhibition “Marie-Laure de Noailles, Peintre, Conversation”, which is also sponsored by CHANEL, explores a lesser-known aspect of the viscountess's life, that of an artist. It will run until January 12th, 2025. Through this commitment, CHANEL and le19M reaffirm their support to young designers, and continue to perpetuate and promote the Métiers d’art’s exceptional savoir-faire. Pictures: 1. Romain Joly and Lisa Bravi, winners of the CHANEL Visual Merchandising Prize. 2. Romain Joly and Lisa Bravi’s creation. 3. 2024 CHANEL Visual Merchandising Prize’s creations. 4 and 5. Exhibition “Marie-Laure de Noailles, Peintre, Conversation” at the Villa Noailles. 6. “Les Gardiens”, exhibition of the work of Arthur Ristor and Anaïs Hervé, winners of the 2023 CHANEL Visual Merchandising Prize.

The Haute Joaillerie Sport Collection. Designed to enhance the freedom of the body and the elegance of movement, the Graphic Line necklace is adorned with a lacework of diamonds and a 10.15-carat cushion-cut sapphire, sourced from an exceptional set of five stones from Kashmir. The chevron motif and the gradation of 24.35 carats of baguette-cut rubies in pure, simple lines evoke rhythm and speed. Patrice Leguéreau, Director of the CHANEL Fine Jewelry Creation Studio, has taken on the challenge of making the reverse side of the necklace as beautiful as the front, displaying on the back the name of the House, a first in High Jewelry. Discover on https://lnkd.in/eDtRGBB3 #CHANELHighJewelry #CHANELHauteJoaillerieSport

Sophisticated and theatrical, the Fall-Winter 2024/25 Haute Couture collection presented by the Fashion Creation Studio mingles the worlds of the opera and of CHANEL Haute Couture. The volumes are diaphanous, the sleeves puffed, and the flounces pleated. Richly embroidered, the collection imbues the House codes with a romantic twist. A CHANEL suit revisited in burgundy tweed trimmed with white satin, a black corduroy tuxedo, a blouse with an embroidered plastron, and a fitted jacket embellished with black feathers, dance among long coats, voluminous capes and evening gowns. For the show, playwright, writer and director Christophe Honoré imagined a mise en scène in the corridors of the Palais Garnier, offering a renewed way to experience the opera.
